alert.note: Alert for Central Marion; Eastern Marion; Western Marion (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 17 at 12:56PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT MARION COUNTY THROUGH 145 PM EDT... At 1256 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Anthony to 8 miles southwest of Santos. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts around 40 mph and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Locations impacted include... Ocala, Fort McCoy, Salt Springs, Juniper Springs, Lynne, Lake Delancy, Weirsdale, Sparr, Anthony, and The Village of Briar Meadow. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Central Marion; Eastern Marion; Western Marion
